db:abstract.db:para: The QTableWidgetItem class provides an item for use with the QTableWidget class.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Table items are used to hold pieces of information for table widgets. Items usually contain text, icons, or checkboxes
The QTableWidgetItem class is a convenience class that replaces the QTableItem class in Qt 3. It provides an item for use with the QTableWidget class.
Top-level items are constructed without a parent then inserted at the position specified by a pair of row and column numbers:

Each item can have its own background brush which is set with the setBackground() function. The current background brush can be found with background(). The text label for each item can be rendered with its own font and brush. These are specified with the setFont() and setForeground() functions, and read with font() and foreground().

By default, items are enabled, editable, selectable, checkable, and can be used both as the source of a drag and drop operation and as a drop target. Each item's flags can be changed by calling setFlags() with the appropriate value (see Qt::ItemFlags). Checkable items can be checked and unchecked with the setCheckState() function. The corresponding checkState() function indicates whether the item is currently checked.

db:section.db:title: Subclassing
db:section.db:para: When subclassing QTableWidgetItem to provide custom items, it is possible to define new types for them so that they can be distinguished from standard items. The constructors for subclasses that require this feature need to call the base class constructor with a new type value equal to or greater than UserType.

db:section.db:title: enum QTableWidgetItem::ItemType
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the types that are used to describe table widget items.

db:td.db:para: The default type for table widget items.
The minimum value for custom types. Values below UserType are reserved by Qt.

db:section.db:para: You can define new user types in QTableWidgetItem subclasses to ensure that custom items are treated specially.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTableWidgetItem::QTableWidgetItem(int type = Type)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a table item of the specified type that does not belong to any table.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTableWidgetItem::QTableWidgetItem(const QString &text, int type = Type)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a table item with the given text.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QTableWidgetItem::QTableWidgetItem(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, int type = Type)

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QTableWidgetItem(const QIcon &icon, const QString &text, int type)

db:section.db:para: Constructs a table item with the given icon and text.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] QTableWidgetItem::QTableWidgetItem(const QTableWidgetItem &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other. Note that type() and tableWidget() are not copied.
This function is useful when reimplementing clone().
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QTableWidgetItem::~QTableWidgetItem()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the table item.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] QBrush QTableWidgetItem::background() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the brush used to render the item's background.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: Qt::CheckState QTableWidgetItem::checkState() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the checked state of the table item.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QTableWidgetItem *QTableWidgetItem::clone() const
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of the item.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] int QTableWidgetItem::column() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the column of the item in the table. If the item is not in a table, this function will return -1.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QVariant QTableWidgetItem::data(int role) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's data for the given role.

db:section.db:title: Qt::ItemFlags QTableWidgetItem::flags() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the flags used to describe the item. These determine whether the item can be checked, edited, and selected.

db:section.db:title: QFont QTableWidgetItem::font() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the font used to render the item's text.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] QBrush QTableWidgetItem::foreground() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the brush used to render the item's foreground (e.g. text).
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: QIcon QTableWidgetItem::icon() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's icon.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] bool QTableWidgetItem::isSelected() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the item is selected, otherwise returns false.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QTableWidgetItem::read(QDataStream &in)
db:section.db:para: Reads the item from stream in.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] int QTableWidgetItem::row() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the row of the item in the table. If the item is not in a table, this function will return -1.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] void QTableWidgetItem::setBackground(const QBrush &brush)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's background brush to the specified brush.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setCheckState(Qt::CheckState state)
db:section.db:para: Sets the check state of the table item to be state.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QTableWidgetItem::setData(int role, const QVariant &value)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's data for the given role to the specified value.

db:note.db:para: The default implementation treats Qt::EditRole and Qt::DisplayRole as referring to the same data.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setFlags(Qt::ItemFlags flags)
db:section.db:para: Sets the flags for the item to the given flags. These determine whether the item can be selected or modified.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setFont(const QFont &font)
db:section.db:para: Sets the font used to display the item's text to the given font.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] void QTableWidgetItem::setForeground(const QBrush &brush)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's foreground brush to the specified brush.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setIcon(const QIcon &icon)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's icon to the icon specified.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] void QTableWidgetItem::setSelected(bool select)
db:section.db:para: Sets the selected state of the item to select.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] void QTableWidgetItem::setSizeHint(const QSize &size)
db:section.db:para: Sets the size hint for the table item to be size. If no size hint is set, the item delegate will compute the size hint based on the item data.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setStatusTip(const QString &statusTip)
db:section.db:para: Sets the status tip for the table item to the text specified by statusTip. QTableWidget mouse tracking needs to be enabled for this feature to work.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setText(const QString &text)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's text to the text specified.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setTextAlignment(int alignment)
db:section.db:para: Sets the text alignment for the item's text to the alignment specified.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setToolTip(const QString &toolTip)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's tooltip to the string specified by toolTip.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setWhatsThis(const QString &whatsThis)
db:section.db:para: Sets the item's "What's This?" help to the string specified by whatsThis.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.1] QSize QTableWidgetItem::sizeHint() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the size hint set for the table item.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.1.

db:section.db:title: QString QTableWidgetItem::statusTip() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's status tip.

db:section.db:title: QTableWidget *QTableWidgetItem::tableWidget() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the table widget that contains the item.

db:section.db:title: QString QTableWidgetItem::text() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's text.

db:section.db:title: int QTableWidgetItem::textAlignment() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the text alignment for the item's text.

db:section.db:title: QString QTableWidgetItem::toolTip() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's tooltip.

db:section.db:title: int QTableWidgetItem::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type passed to the QTableWidgetItem constructor.

db:section.db:title: QString QTableWidgetItem::whatsThis() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the item's "What's This?" help.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] void QTableWidgetItem::write(QDataStream &out) const
db:section.db:para: Writes the item to stream out.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] bool QTableWidgetItem::operator<(const QTableWidgetItem &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the item is less than the other item; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QTableWidgetItem &QTableWidgetItem::operator=(const QTableWidgetItem &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other's data and flags to this item. Note that type() and tableWidget() are not copied.
This function is useful when reimplementing clone().

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &out, const QTableWidgetItem &item)
db:section.db:para: Writes the table widget item item to stream out.
This operator uses QTableWidgetItem::write().

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &in, QTableWidgetItem &item)
db:section.db:para: Reads a table widget item from stream in into item.
This operator uses QTableWidgetItem::read().

db:section.db:title: Obsolete Members for QTableWidgetItem
db:section.db:para: The following members of class QTableWidgetItem are deprecated. We strongly advise against using them in new code.

db:section.db:title: QColor QTableWidgetItem::backgroundColor() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This function is deprecated. Use background() instead.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setBackgroundColor(const QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This function is deprecated. Use setBackground() instead.

db:section.db:title: void QTableWidgetItem::setTextColor(const QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This function is deprecated. Use setForeground() instead.

db:section.db:title: QColor QTableWidgetItem::textColor() const
db:section.db:para: This function is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.
This function is deprecated. Use foreground() instead.
